condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Women and children on the move have access to sustainable safe drinking water and adequate sanitation.

description.narrative: Over the period, UNICEF covered the essential WASH needs in shelters, with an average of 7,000 Venezuelan benefiting each month from safe water supplies and behavior change activities, because of UNICEF's direct support. In the same shelters, UNICEF helped more than 9,665 people gain access to essential hygiene items and basic sanitation trough maintenance and cleaning scheme and reached over 15,000 children with improved WASH facilities and services in learning spaces. Out of shelter, UNICEF provided 2,858 from most vulnerable Venezuelan families with water filters. UNICEF, in support to FUNASA, co-lead the WASH coordination group. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:06/02/2020
